result.execSummary:
The defendant Thad J Stoelb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thad J Stoelb is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thad J Stoelb was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.
Defendant to submit DNA sample.

of payment
DNA proof of submission - original

Juror selection and peremptory challenges
Random listing report
Total cost of case

In chambers:  instructions provided to parties.  Motions in Limine discussed.  Court will allow audio tape with a curative instruction.  Defendant likely will not testify.  Witnesses prior records discussed, instructions discussed.  Witnesses sequestered.  9:05 a.m jurors receive their first oath.  Voir dire by parties.  Jurors chosen to try the issues receive their second oath.  Recess at 9:30 a.m. jury retires.  At 9:40 defendant wishes to change his plea to no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty of Count 1, Count 2 dismissed.  Arguments as to penalty.  Court orders $200 + costs and DNA sample.  Defendant indicates he has an extradition pending to New York State and will likely go to prison so does not have the ability to pay.  Jury brought back into courtroom and explained situation and dismissed.

Atty Weerts - parties are proceeding to JT Feb. 21, witness lists are filed.  Court advises parties are to be in chambers @ 8:15 am day of trial, if parties agree to resolution, must notify court by 4pm (prefer by 12 noon). Late resolution may result in Jury fees being assessed.

hand delivered court notice to defendant

Defendant Thad J Stoelb in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Appearing voluntarily because he missed court on the 28th.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant missed court because he was in Brown County Jail.  Released on 10-29-15.  ADA White asks the court to continue the $1000 cash warrant/bond.  Defendant has failed to appear before...also, he was released and waited 7 days to appear.  Atty Weerts was in contact with defendant yesterday and informs the court that Mr. Stoelb was in contact with his agent, etc.  
Judge cautions defendant, he will not be given more chances, etc.  Quash the warrant.  Reinstate the bond.  Stop the forfeiture proceedings.    Bond continues with all conditions.
failed to appear 10-28-15

Defend Attorney Steven Edward Weerts in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not in court.  Atty Weerts states he lives in Gresham.  $1000 cash warrant authorized.  Forfeiture of bond to commence.
Pre-trial conference at 10-28-2015 02:00 pm
Pre-trial conference at 09-15-2015 02:15 pm

Defendant Thad J Stoelb in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant.  Defendant was working long hours and missed his pretrial date.  Bond forfeiture vacated.

Attorney Steven Edward Weerts in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE not present.  ADA White requests warrant, $1000 Cash or body. Court authorizes warrant as requested, orders forfeiture of bond.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 08-04-2015 04:00 pm
